text: The Bole–Tangale languages (also called A.2 West Chadic languages) are a branch of West Chadic languages. They are spoken in Northeastern Nigeria. ==Branches== The Bole–Tangale languages are:Blench, Roger. 2006. The Afro- Asiatic Languages: Classification and Reference List (ms) *Bole (Bole–Tangale) (A.2) **North (Bole proper): Bure, Karekare, Bole, Gera, Geruma, Deno, Galambu, Giiwo, Kubi, Ngamo, Maaka (Maagha), Ɓeele, Daza (Dazawa), ?Pali **South (Tangale): Kwaami, Pero, Piya-Kwonci, Kulungv, Kholok, Nyam, Kushi (Goji), Kutto (Kupto), Tangale, Dera (Kanakuru) ==References== Category:West Chadic languages Category:Languages of Nigeria
title: Bole–Tangale languages
